section.title: Macaulay Duration Shortcuts
section.p: For zero-coupon bonds, level-payment annuities, and coupon bonds, there are shortcuts for calculating the Macaulay duration.

statement.p: Find the Macaulay duration of an n-year zero-coupon bond with maturity X, priced to yield \iota. Explain why your result makes conceptual sense.

introduction.p: Find the Macaulay duration for each of the following:

task.p: A zero-coupon bond with maturity of 1000 in five years, priced to yield 3%.
A bond with semiannual coupons of 5% with a face value of 10,000 and a term of ten years, priced to yield 4.5%.

Anticipated cash flows of 10 million at the end of years 1, 2, 3, and 4, 12 million at the end of years 5 through 10, and a final payout of 20 million at the end of year 11. The cash flows are priced to yield 5%.
A level payment annuity with quarterly payments of 2750 for 5 years, with \iota^{(4)} = 1\%.

statement.p: Are the shortcuts worth memorizing? Why or why not?
